item.title: Cheaper DS3 Connections
item.description:
Your business needs more bandwidth, but the price of a DS3 connection might seem daunting. While upgrading from a T1 line to a DS3 might have seemed expensive in the past, prices have gone down. Even with the current economic climate, a DS3 connection could now be within your budget. DS3, or Data Service level 3, is a digital telecommunications standard initially designed for telephone systems. It’s part of the T-Carrier system and works seamlessly with SONET fiber optic networks...

item.title: Escape the High Cost of Bonded T1 Lines
item.description:
By: John Shepler The T1 line, a pioneering technology in digital communication, remains relevant for private lines, telephone trunking, and internet access even after fifty years. However, the cost of achieving higher bandwidth by combining multiple lines can be expensive, prompting a search for alternatives. item.title: Telecommunication DS3 Affordable For Business
item.description:
Modern businesses need increasing levels of bandwidth to accommodate computer-driven processes that enhance productivity. When a T1 line reaches its capacity, and more bandwidth is necessary, there are options to consider. A logical next step, if bandwidth needs have gradually increased, is to bond a second T1 line with the first. This doubles the capacity, providing a 3 Mbps WAN connection.
